description:
COMMUNITY VISIT & DISCUSSION at the CCA Exhibit: 'It's All Happening So Fast: A Counter-History of the Modern Canadian Environment'. On the occasion of Canada's 150th anniversary in 2017, the Centre Canadien d'Architecture / Canadian Centre for Architecture (CCA) presents an exhibition that challenges basic assumptions about the country's relationship to nature by chronicling the modern history of environmental disasters in Canada. Curated by CCA Director Mirko Zardini, 'It's All Happening So Fast: A Counter-History of the Modern Canadian Environment' explores the contradictory relationship between Canada's idealized wilderness and its simultaneous exploitation of the environment.Solidarite Communautaire - Building Community, has organised this community visit and discussion to this extraordinary exhibition. The CCA has agreed to provide free entry and two free guided tours (one in French and one in English) of the exhibition. Afterward, there will be a sit-down discussion in the beautiful Shaughnessy House to allow participants to exchange thoughts, perspectives and hopes for a community response to the ecological crisis.Saturday, February 11th, 1-3pm. Canadian Centre for Architecture1920, rue Baile, Montreal, QC H3H 2S61-2 pm (English and French guided tours)2-3 pm (Discussion)Refreshments will be served.Free admission.Please RSVP (ideally by Tuesday, February 8th) with your preferred language (for the guided tour) to: victoria.coon@mail.McGill.ca


This event is part of Building Community's February event series on the climate crisis and radical ecology:PUBLIC LECTURE: The Climate Crisis in the Age of Trump (with Brian Tokar). Thursday, February 2nd, 5:30-7:30pm.https://www.facebook.com/events/726462274177034/WORKSHOP & DISCUSSION: Theory & Practice of Social Ecology (with Brian Tokar). Friday, February 3rd, 1-3pm.https://www.facebook.com/events/1369248739763624/COMMUNITY VISIT & DISCUSSION at the CCA Exhibit: 'It's All Happening So Fast, A Counter-History of the Modern Canadian Environment'. Saturday, February 11th, 1-3pm. (The guided tours will be bilingual and will be followed by a sit-down discussion. Free entry and refreshments included.)https://www.facebook.com/events/1242741405763093/Endorsed by: Climate Justice Montreal, Milton-Park Citizens' Committee - Comite Citoyennes Milton-Parc, ECOLE (McGill), Quebec Public Interest Research Group QPIRG (McGill) and Black Rose Books.'Building Community-Solidarite communautaire' is a citizens' education project of the Milton Parc Citizens' Committee (CCMP-MPCC) in Montreal. // 'Solidarite Communautaire-Building Community' est un programme d'education citoyenne du Comite Citoyen-ne-s de Milton-Parc (CCMP - MPCC) a Montreal.
name: CCA bilingual guided tour: It's All Happening So Fast

description:
Description (English below)





Si vous etes passionne(e) du jardinage, vous aviez assurement acheter des plantes ou des semences. Certes, il a plusieurs especes de plantes qui s'echappe de la culture par semence directe au sol a cause de notre climat (meme si un rechauffement se produit), alors nous optons pour l'achat de plantules (c-a-d.: jeunes plantes). Pour ces plantes (ex: tomates, cerises de terre, tabac, groseilles, oignions, pommes de mai, etc.), les pepinnieres commencent leurs semis a l'interieurs quelque temps avant le printemps afin de mener leurs plantules au marche. Quoique partir ses propres plantules peut sembler domptant comme tache, un bon melange de croissance avec des bonnes pratiques horticoles nous permet d'augmenter notre taux de succes.





Cet atelier est accessible a tous les niveaux de connaissances, mais vise les debutants/intermediaires. Nous allons voir les fondements physico-chimiques des melanges de croissance ainsi que les techniques de germination, l'eclairage artificiel et l'endurcissement des plantules.


 


Vous quitterez l'atelier avec:


Un plateau d'ensemencement avec 72 cellules de croissance


Suffisamment de melange de croissance pour partir vos semences


Des semences de votre choix provenant de notre selection d'au-dessus de 30 especes de plantes differentes


Les connaissances requises afin de partir la communaute de plantes qui garnira votre balcon ou potager en terre cet ete 





*Prendre note que quoique l'atelier est gratuit, un frais de 10$/participant est administre afin de couvrir les couts des materiaux.





Description





If you are passionate about gardening, you have already purchased plants or seeds in the past. However there are many plant species that escape direct seeding due to our climate (even with increasing temperatures), so we revert to purchasing seedlings. For these plants (e.g.: tomatoes, ground cherries, tobacco, currants, onions, mayapples, etc.), nurseries will go through many steps before the growing season typically involving a greenhouse or other similar growing facilities to bring these seedlings to market. Although starting your own seeds indoors may seem daunting at first, a good growing mix with appropriate horticultural practices can lead to very successful results.





This workshop is accessible to everyone but targets beginners and intermediary participants alike. We will go through the physico-chemical fundamentals of growing mixes as well as germination techniques, artificial lighting and seedling hardening before planting outdoors.


 


You will leave this workshop with:


A growing tray and 72 starter cells


Enough growing mix to start your seedlings


Seeds from our selection of over 30 different plant species


The knowledge required to get your plant community started for your balcony or soil garden for the summer





*Please take note that although the workshop is free, there is a 10$ charge to cover the cost of materials.
name: Commencer ses semis et melange de croissance/Seed starting and growing mix

description:
Free Webinar
8 Steps to Becoming an Alchemist: Lesson 2-Setting up End-results
Hello everyone and welcome!
I will be hosting a series of live webinars based on the book "The Alchemist's Workbook", by Arush Bakshi and myself, Chloe Bourjalliat.
Each webinar will correspond to a lesson in the book. There are 8 lessons, and so there will be 8 webinars, spread out over 8 weeks, mostly every Sunday of the week.
This webinar is FREE and will be presented LIVE by myself.
When registering you will receive a link to the webinar, at the time of the webinar, simply click on the link to start.
If you cannot attend the live webinar, do not panic! It will be recorded and posted straight to Youtube, so you can listen to it whenever you are free, and can even go back to it to refresh your memory.
Because this is a series of 8 lessons, I strongly suggest you do listen to the whole series to get the best results possible!
Please bare in mind that this webinar will be at 7pm Spanish Time, so make sure you check what time it corresponds to for you.


Below you will find the Preface of our book for more information:

We have been intensely studying and applying the principles of Alchemy in our lives, on a daily basis. And ever since day one, we have seen continuous positive changes taking place in ourselves, our goals and the people around us. In a very short time, we have evolved to a happier and fulfilled life, where we have never been more challenged and never been more prepared to take on these challenges. 
Before taking up this work, we were both slaves to our own egos. We navigated the world thinking that we knew what we wanted and we knew how to get there. The egoic orientation provides a very narrow point of view to life, making you/us/everyone blind to the real possibilities that lie outside that point of view. With this work, in a very short space of time, we (along with so many of our colleagues) have managed to achieve and create things for ourselves that we would have never thought possible, based on our egoic frames of mind.
We have first hand seen that the methods and techniques included in this workbook work for everyone, no matter who they are, where they come from or what circumstances they are in. And therefore, as coaches, we decided to combine our knowledge into a simple product that could reach and have a positive impact on the masses.
This is how The Alchemist's Workbook was born!
This workbook is designed to fit into anyone's life, no matter how busy or financially limited that person might be. The purpose of this book is to empower people to overcome their problems, obstacles & circumstances and to move on towards a life they truly desire. 
In case it was not obvious, the theme of this book is Alchemy: the process of converting lead into gold. But what alchemy truly means is converting your ego into your true self.
This workbook is so powerful, that even during the writing process we actually learned more about ourselves, and how we sabotage ourselves.
This book is not a one-time read. We would suggest you go over it again once you have completed it. There is always more to learn.
Finally, we would like to thank Natural Success, the co-founders and our mentors, William Whitecloud and Ryan Pinnick for introducing this work to us and taking us to the level of mastery (and beyond). Life truly hasn't been the same since day one. We would also like to thank the rest of the team of Natural Success and our colleagues who are on the same journey as us, without them we wouldn't be where we are.

ABOUT THE AUTHORS
Chloe Bourjalliat is a French/American national, raised between Paraguay, France, and the Caribbean, in a family of adventurers. She has recently completed a Master's degree in Translation and Interpreting in London and is now working freelance. After several years investigating herself through self-development techniques, alchemy is what unlocked her true self. She has now become a life coach and hosts regular workshops, webinars and coaching sessions in English, French, and Spanish. Chloe's ultimate vision is to create a global shift in consciousness.
Arush Bakshi is born and raised in New Delhi, India, from a family of businessmen. Following a Bachelor's degree in Business, in London, Arush rebelled against his family's expectations to enter the corporate world after he was introduced to the work of alchemy. He pursued extensive self-development training in London and has now become a life and business coach. Arush hosts regular workshops helping individuals reach their true potential in Business and in Life. He is also currently writing on a super-hero novel to be adapted as a TV series. Arush is a spiritual geek at heart.
name: Free Webinar: 8 Steps in Becoming an Alchemist-Lesson 2

description:
Pour tous les entrepreneurs et curieux!
La cooperative est un modele d'entreprise encore peu connu pour la plupart. Reseau COOP offre, a chaque 6 semaines, une formation d'initiation sur le modele des cooperatives pour repondre aux questionnements et demystifier cette forme d'entreprise.
Cette formation gratuite est ouverte a tous et couvre tous les aspects a connaitre pour comprendre les cooperatives et leur fonctionnement.
Pour lancer votre entreprise ou simplement pour attiser votre curiosite, cette formation est donnee par une professionnelle du milieu qui saura repondre a toutes vos questions. 
Parmi les sujets abordes:
- Les cooperatives de travail et les cooperatives de solidarite
- La structure interne (comment on gere ca, une coop?)
- La structure du capital (les possibilites d'investissements et la repartition des profits
- Les conditions de reussite
- Les modes de financement
- La creation d'une coop et les ressources specialisees d'accompagnement

Veuillez noter que cette formation est offerte en francais, mais vous pouvez communiquer avec notre equipe au Reseau COOP si vous desirez une formation en anglais.
Please note that this event is given in french, but you can get in touch with our team at Reseau COOP if you have any questions or wish to schedule a meeting/conference in english.

Il est important de vous inscrire, car les places sont limitees. Via courriel: info@reseau.coopVia telephone: 514-526-6267Via EventBrite
name: C'est quoi, une COOP?  Session d'information sur les cooperatives

description:
Strategie et redaction pour le numerique
Vous voulez rejoindre vos visiteurs, leur inspirer confiance et les convertir en consommateurs, voire en ambassadeurs de votre marque ?
Une redaction numerique bien calibree permet d'humaniser et de dynamiser vos interactions numeriques qui peuvent sembler froides et impersonnelles a prime abord.
Une redaction reflechie met tout en oeuvre pour etablir un dialogue captivant avec l'utilisateur. Elle reduit la friction : les doutes, les ambiguites, les insecurites aux points de contact nevralgiques entre votre organisation et les utilisateurs de vos proprietes numeriques.
AVANTAGES DU COURS

Amelioration de l'engagement client
Augmentation du taux de conversion
Renforcement de la marque

OBJECTIFS

Faire le lien entre les clients, les objectifs d'affaires et la strategie de contenu
Decouvrir les etapes de la planification des contenus et la structure d'une architecture de l'information
Apprendre les principes de base de la simplification du style et de l'humanisation du propos
Apprendre a rediger pour faciliter l'orientation, le reperage d'information et la realisation de taches
Apprendre a optimiser les contenus pour differents contextes : les sites web, les medias sociaux, les infolettres (courriels) et les applications mobiles.

CONTENU DU COURS
Le cours Strategie et redaction pour le numerique porte sur la qualite du texte comme vecteur d'information, d'orientation et d'action.
Nous regarderons comment le choix des mots dans l'interface peut nuire ou faciliter non seulement le reperage, la lecture et le la comprehension des informations, mais aussi le niveau de confiance, la convivialite, la completion des taches cles, et le niveau d'engagement des utilisateurs avec votre organisation.
PUBLIC CIBLE
Cette formation s'adresse aux responsables du marketing, conseillers en communication, concepteurs, redacteurs, architectes d'informations, chefs de produit, bref a toute personne appelee a rediger des textes pour le numerique ou a adapter des contenus initialement concus et rediges pour un autre medium, typiquement un support imprime.
QUI DONNE LA FORMATION?
A l'oeuvre dans le domaine interactif depuis 1994, Andre-Claude Potvin est titulaire d'une maitrise en communication. Il a participe au developpement d'une methodologie de developpement de sites web des 1996 au sein du Centre de recherche informatique de Montreal (CRIM).
Il a ensuite agi comme conseiller et chef de projet au sein d'agences interactives. L'Organisation des Nations Unies et le Ministere des Relations Internationales (Quebec) ont fait appel a son expertise pour revoir l'architecture de l'information et l'utilisabilite de leurs sites web. Pendant cinq ans il a ete en charge du developement de contenu pour les sites web du Vieux-Port de Montreal et du Centre des sciences de Montreal.
Aujourd'hui, il agit comme gestionnaire de produit, experience utilisateur chez l'entreprise Triton Digital, qui dessert les radiodiffuseurs avec une plateforme de webdiffusion et de publicite audio ciblee. Il enseigne la redaction pour Internet a l'Universite de Montreal depuis 2006, et la strategie de contenu a l'Universite de Sherbrooke depuis 2012.

DUREE ET TARIFS
1 journee (de 9h a 16h30)
Tarif regulier 640 $ + taxes
Rabais de groupe (3+) 540 $ + taxes
name: Cours UX - Strategie et redaction pour le numerique

description:
Hi All,
We offer PMP training on weekdays and weekends in 8 hrs and 4hrs per day format.
Key Features
32 hours of Interactive Online Classroom100% Money Back GuaranteePMBOK(r) Guide  5th Edition from PMIPMP(r) Mock Exams and Mock ProjectsGroup Activities for better reinforcementFree WebinarsReal world examples from various industriesIndustry based case studiesLife time access to classroom recordingsTrainers' Notes, Sample Question Paper & Case Studies35 Contact hours certificatePMP exam application assistance24/7 customer support                                                                                                                                        
About the Course
Project Management Professional (PMP(r)) certification is the top professional certifications for project managers offered by the Project Management Institute, USA. PMI's latest salary survey confirms what businesses, job boards and the media have been proclaiming for the past two years: Project management is one of the hottest professions out there. Your PMI credential -- specifically, the Project Management Professional (PMP)(r) credential -- also positively impacts your salary, according to the survey responses of more than 30,000 practitioners in 29 countries. The positive impact is not exclusive to the U.S. PMP credential holders in all countries surveyed noted higher median salaries than non-credential holders -- some upwards of 50 percent more.
Who needs to attend?
Associate project managers, project managers, IT project managers, project coordinators, project analysts, project leaders, senior project managers, team leaders, product managers, program managers, project sponsors, and project team members seeking the PMP or CAPM certification.
What is this course about?
PMP training from Softlearning is a unique, power packed, career-ready package and one of a kind in the industry. Project Management Professional (PMP(r)) certification is the topmost professional certification for project managers offered by the Project Management Institute.
What learning benefits do you get from Softlearning's training?
Establish a common vocabulary and understanding of basic Project Management terms and concepts such as PMBOK(r), project, Project management, operations, programs, stakeholders, earned value, scheduling techniques, and project managers' responsibilities and competencies.
Describe the purpose, inputs, and outputs of the processes in each of the five Process Groups: Initiating, Planning, Executing, Monitoring & Controlling, and Closing
Define the 10 Project Management Knowledge areas & the processes in each. Define & explain the relationship of process groups, Knowledge areas, project phases, project &product life cycle
Demonstrate a clear understanding of what activities, tools, & techniques, are necessary in each phase of a project & understand the PMP(r) examination nuances
Understand, acknowledge & appreciate importance of risk management. Learn tools and techniques for managing the risks in projects
Overview of Critical Chain Project Management (CCPM) & discussion on concept of Buffer Management.
Help the participants to understand one, understand others, and manage the interface more efficiently & effectively. Understanding the impact of organizational structures on projects
Discussion on project manager's professional responsibilities.
With the help of case studies, motivating the participants to use the principles of Project Management in their own Work area discussed with the help of case studies.
Why choose Softlearning for your training?
Softlearning is the World's top IT and professional skill development Training Provider, with over 400,000+ professionals trained globally
Trusted by the Fortune 500 companies as their learning provider for career growth and training
4000+ certified and experienced trainers conduct trainings for various courses across the globe
We had excellent track record of 99% pass rate in first attempt
Please contact us for more details at support@softlearning.cm or visit us www.softlearning.co or http://softlearning.co/projectmanagement-pmpcerticication
Thanks & Regards,
Dave Anderson
Senior Inside Sales Manager

description:
Une formation pour les professionnels de l'education
Besoin d'etre accompagne pour integrer le CerebroGym de SCIENCE EN JEU en classe? Notre equipe d'enseignants ambassadeurs et nos concepteurs pedagogiques seront ravis de vous partager leur savoir-faire et leurs trucs pour adopter cet outil en classe. 
Cette journee de formation s'adresse specifiquement aux :


Enseignants du primaire et du secondaire


Conseillers pedagogiques


Orthopedagogues


Orthophonistes 


Psychoeducateurs


Psychologues scolaires      


Parents et adultes ayant des troubles d'apprentissage


Intervenants du milieu de l'education ou de la sante


Les acteurs de l'ecole touches tout particulierement par cette formation : 


Classes ressources


Adaptation scolaire


Pre-dep 


PFAE


Regulier


La formation se compose de deux ateliers. En avant-midi, le programme du CerebroGym vous sera presente. Puis, apres un repas fourni par notre equipe, vous serez invite a experimenter le contenu de ce programme de remediation cognitive et de psychoeducation, guide par notre formatrice. Une formation stimulante qui permet d'adapter le contenu de chaque atelier aux besoins des participants. 
Les ressources qui seront presentees lors de cette journee sont : 


Le portail du CerebroGym et son fonctionnement


Le programme de remediation cognitive et de psychoeducation du CerebroGym


Le suivi enseignant / parental


L'acces a SCIENCE EN JEU et a ses jeux educatifs, dont Clic mathematique


Langue : francais
Duree : deux ateliers de 90 a 120 minutes chacun
Nombre de participants : 8 a 25 personnes
Cout : 125$/pers (un nombre minimum de participants est requis)
Les participants peuvent apporter leur ordinateur portable. Une dizaine d'ordinateurs seront egalement disponibles sur place grace a notre collaboration avec  l'OPEQ.
C'est le temps de vous faire plaisir, venir apprendre, vous renouveler et rencontrer vos pairs. Voila l'occasion de decouvrir et d'experimenter des contenus educatifs ludiques pertinents pour l'enseignement.

Qu'est-ce que le CerebroGym?
Le CerebroGym stimule les capacites d'attention, tout en donnant des trucs et des defis quotidiens pour mieux vivre avec un deficit d'attention. Les 60 sessions du programme ont ete developpees par des neuropsychologues des services hospitaliers ainsi que des orthophonistes et formateurs en sciences cognitives du studio GERIP.
Ce programme a ete integre dans un monde virtuel pour augmenter la motivation des enfants.Les activites interactives du CerebroGym sont tirees de logiciels utilises par plus de 10 000 professionnels de la sante au Canada et en France et plus d'un million d'usagers. Le programme vise tous les jeunes souhaitant beneficier d'une plus grande capacite d'attention, qu'un diagnostic de TDA/H ait ete pose ou non.  
Pour decouvrir cet univers :
1. Explorez les sections Intervenants et Profs du portail CerebroGym
2. Explorez les deux sessions d'essai gratuitement en vous inscrivant au CerebroGym (cliquez sur le bouton Jouer! Clique ici)
3. Visitez la page Profs de SCIENCE EN JEU 
4. Abonnez-vous a la page Facebook de SCIENCE EN JEU
5. Abonnez-vous a notre fil Twitter @scienceenjeu
name: Cervelle electrique et le TDAH

description:
Il est surprenant de voir en entreprise des utilisateurs se servir de MS Excel pour manipuler des listes de donnees alors que le logiciel approprie MS Access est installe sur leur poste de travail. Pourquoi ? Parce que tres peu savent l'utiliser et le considerent comme complexe ou comme un logiciel "d'informaticiens". Il n'en est rien. Nous allons vous montrer lors de cette formation qu'il est plus facile et plus aise de manipuler des listes de donnees avec MS Access plutot qu'avec MS Excel.

OBJECTIF
Ce seminaire de six (6) heures est destine a donner aux utilisateurs desirant rapidement acquerir les competences necessaires a la conception et la maintenance d'interface utilisateur et de rapports a l'aide de Microsoft Access.
PUBLIC VISE

PREALABLES

METHODOLOGIE
L'alternance de la theorie et de la pratique permettra aux participants d'acquerir et de mettre en application les notions acquises afin de creer des formulaires et des etats. A l'issue de cette formation, les participants maitriseront l'ensemble des mecanismes leur permettant de profiter pleinement de toute la puissance de Microsoft Access.

description:
Ce programme comprend 8 ateliers qui permettra aux entrepreneures d'exploiter le potentiel de leur entreprise. Il permettra l'entrepreneure d'analyser et d'orienter son entreprise, tout en mettant en oeuvre des actions concretes afin d'en assurer la croissance et la reussite.
Pour qui? : Femmes entrepreneures qui sont deja en affaires depuis au moins 2 ans et qui s'ont pretes a aller au prochain niveau.
Objectifs ?  La planification strategique precise a l'exploration d'un projet d'affaires vous aide a atteindre les objectifs suivants.

Evaluer votre entreprise - en examinant tous les facteurs internes et externes ayant un impact sur vos activites (finances, service a la clientele, marketing et ventes, operations et procedures, equipe et/ou collaborateurs-partenaires, technologie et innovation, impact communautaire, tendances, etc.)
Etablir une nouvelle vision et direction - en examinant la mission, la vision, les valeurs ainsi que les services et/ou produits et les objectifs etablis auparavent suite a l'evaluation de votre entreprise
Etablir vos priorites et de nouveaux objectifs - en explorant de nouvelles idees face au developpement organisationnel de votre entreprise, en designant vos champions (personnes ressources qui soutiendrons vos actions) ainsi que des objectifs a court terme 
Formuler des strategies - en fonction des strategies et observations precedentes
Mettre vos strategies en place - en evaluant vos ressources et en creant votre plan d'actions
Mesurer votre reussite - en suivant vos progres et en ajustant vos demarches au besoin.

Valeurs ajoutees du programme ? A travers ce programme, vous serez en mesure de non seulement creer une strategie d'affaires afin d'elever votre entreprise a un autre niveau, mais vous pourrez egalement  :

Explorer des solutions et opportunites (produits, services, forfaits, promotions, collaborations, etc.) que vous n'avez pas encore exploitees ;
Obtenir des outils essentiels afin d'evaluer tous les aspects cles au bon fonctionnement de votre entreprise ainsi que des outils de planifications strategique fondamentales que vous pourriz utiliser de nouveau afin de creer de nouvelles strategies au fur et a mesure que vous developperez votre entreprise ;
Maximiser votre apprentissage et votre developpement professionnel a travers le partage d'idees et d'experiences en groupe grace a une coach d'affaires professionnelles 

Deroulement ?

1 seance de 3 heures au deux semaines pendant 4 mois pour un total de 8 seances
Reponse aux courriel et appels telephonique entre chaque seance de formation ;
1 seance de coaching personnalise de 2 heures par participant durant le semestre selon les disponibilites communes du coach et du participant ;

Conditions: Etre entre 6-10 participantes 
Dates : Les mercredis de 13hrs a 16hrs : 2-16-30 novembre, 14 decembre, 11-25 janvier, 8-22 fevrier 2017
Prix: Ce programme vous est offert pour 320$, soit 40$ par seance! Toutefois, vous devez etre membre Classique ou Elegance pour y participer. 
Promotion: Reservez votre place avant le 18 octobre et obtenez votre adhesion Classique. Simplement ajoutez l'adhesion Classique (onglet MEMBRE) ainsi que le code promo a votre panier d'achat: 100ADHESION lorsque vous etes dans votre panier d'achat. 
 
Par qui? MON ATELIER fournit des services de developpement professionnel et organisationnel afin de former et encadrer les entrepreneurs ainsi que les PME. Nous sommes orientes vers le developpement, Nous avons developpe une specialite a travailler avec de jeunes entreprises (5 ans ou moins) en leur fournissant une base solide. 
*************
Le Centre Leaders au Feminin a pour mission d'apporter un soutien aux femmes qui desirent se lancer en affaires ou accroitre leur entreprise. Permettre enfin aux femmes de vivre leurs reves entrepreneuriaux sans avoir l'impression d'etre seule. Le manque de temps, de ressources financieres et de ressources joue un grand role dans la vie de ces femmes.
Savoir bien s'entourer, s'entraider et s'epanouir sont les cles pour atteindre le succes entrepreneurial. Visant a offrir un soutien complet a ces femmes, notre equipe de specialistes offrent des formations/ateliers, des conferences et des evenements de reseautage repondant a leurs besoins et leur realite. Le Centre Leaders au Feminin, ce n'est pas un centre comme les autres, c'est l'endroit ideal pour s'enrichir de connaissances et faire partie d'un reseau d'entraide! #leadersaufeminin

description:
UX-PM 1 - ADOPTION UX


Vous etes-vous deja demande comment inclure l'experience utilisateur (UX) dans un projet? Comment integrer les outils UX dans votre cycle de developpement? Comment developper une culture centree sur le client?
La certification UX-PM 1 s'adresse aux chefs de produits, aux responsables marketing et aux gestionnaires de projets qui veulent comprendre les fondements du UX, qui souhaitent adopter les methodologies UX au sein de projets et encourager la culture du design centre sur le client dans leurs organisations.


OBJECTIFS


UX-PM 1: Adoption UX

Comprendre les concepts UX cles, les methodes et les defis courants
Saisir les avantages de l'approche UX
Se familiariser avec les outils et les methodes UX
Apprendre les methodes pour integrer l'experience utilisateur dans vos projets numeriques
Devenir un ambassadeur UX dans votre organisation



CLIENTELE VISEE


Les responsables TI et de projets numeriques, y compris les chefs de produits, les responsables marketing, les charges de comptes et les gestionnaires de projets. Tous ceux qui s'interessent a l'experience utilisateur et qui cherchent a savoir comment l'integrer dans leurs projets. Aucun prerequis n'est necessaire en dehors de votre curiosite pour le UX et la certification UX-PM 1.


CONTENU DU COURS


A partir d'une definition claire de ce qu'est reellement l'experience utilisateur et ce que ce n'est pas, cette formation vise a demystifier entierement le UX. Ce cours couvre les sujets suivants:

L'experience de l'utilisateur, la conception centree sur l'utilisateur, le design des interactions, l'utilisabilite, le contexte d'usage et la facon dont tous ces facteurs sont relies.
Les idees preconcues, les defis du UX, et les disciplines communes
Les caracteristiques des usagers et la relation avec le design (mecanismes cognitifs, reponses emotionnelles, etc.)
Principes et avantages d'integrer des activites UX dans le developpement de produits
Comment et quand impliquer les utilisateurs dans le processus - les methodes et la valeur d'une strategie fondee sur la collaboration et l'empathie
Comment integrer les idees et suggestions des usagers recueillies aux differentes phases du cycle de developpement (de la strategie a a la conception)
Couts, defis, avantages et gains (RSI) d'integrer les activites UX dans un processus de developpement
Le UX comme outil de communication et les moyens de promouvoir la valeur UX au sein d'une organisation
Immersion et application pratique: revue de plusieurs etudes de cas, discussions et jeux de role pour aiguiser le regard des participants face au UX et a l'utilisabilite. Une combinaison de theorie et d'exercices de resolution de problemes.



EXAMEN DE CERTIFICATION


L'examen de la certification UX-PM 1 a lieu a la fin de la deuxieme journee de formation. L'examen est compose d'un test a choix multiples, suivie par un entretien en tete-a -tete avec l'instructeur.



Qui donne la formation?







Annemarie Lesage dirige l'equipe de l'experience utilisateur (recherche et design) de l'agence Yu Centrik. Son equipe est composee de specialistes en recherche utilisateur, de strateges et de concepteurs UX, tout en integrant la conception collaborative dans les processus d'ideation et d'innovation. Elle detient un doctorat en design industriel (Universite de Montreal),  ses recherches portent sur les dimensions emotionnelles de l'experience utilisateur.Annemarie a fait partie du groupe d'experience utilisateur de modelisation de Sapient - XMod en 2000, a New York. Depuis 2003, elle a enseigne divers cours a l'Universite Laval (recherche de conception co-enseignement en 2005), a Concordia, a l'UQAM et a l'Universite de Montreal (conception de l'experience, depuis 2010). Annemarie est un professeure extraordinaire, entierement bilingue et tres bien connectee au milieu des affaires.






Lieu et tarifs


2 jours completTarif regulier 1 850 $ + taxes -
Rabais de groupe (3+) 1 480 $ + taxes
La certification canadienne UX-PM 1 est actuellement disponible a: Ottawa, Montreal, Toronto et Quebec. Ailleurs dans le monde, la certification est offerte aux Etats-Unis, Australie, Belgique, Bresil, Finlande, France, Inde, Mexique, Pologne, Afrique du Sud, et la Suisse, d'autres pays vont s'ajouter.


Questions?


Communiquez avec Joelle Stemp chez Yu Centrik












POLITIQUE D'ANNULATION ET DROITS D'AUTEUR


Yu Centrik, l'agence specialisee en UX, se reserve le droit d'annuler un cours jusqu'a 5 jours ouvrables avant la date du cours prevu si le nombre minimum de 4 participants n'a pas ete atteint.
Yu Centrik n'est pas responsable des frais de deplacements, d'hebergement, ou de toute autre depense engagee a la suite d'une annulation.
Pour toute annulation effectuee plus de 4 semaines avant la date prevue du cours, le cours sera rembourse a hauteur de 85 % de sa valeur. Dans le cas d'une annulation dans les 3 a 4 semaines avant la date prevue du cours, un remboursement de 50 % est applique.
Aucun remboursement ne sera effectue lorsque l'annulation survient dans la semaine precedente le cours.
name: Certification UX niveau 1 - Montreal

description:
Vendre, negocier, c'est avant tout une question de capacite d'influence, de connexion, d'ajustement de discours et de determination.
Bien que ces notions paraissent abstraites, elles peuvent etre fortement developpees en utilisant les outils et attitudes que cette formation se propose de vous transmettre.


Cette formation vous permettra de :

Vous fixer de vrais objectifs ambitieux
Developper votre capacite d'ecoute active 
Comprendre la facon dont votre client prend ses decisions et saisir quelles sont ses motivations et preoccupation intrinseques
Personnaliser votre discours pour maximiser votre impact en situation de vente
Vous preparer facilement et efficacement pour donner une excellente premiere impression.




Cette formation comporte des enseignements theoriques mais aussi, beaucoup de temps de pratique, sur des cas concrets de la vie quotidienne des participants.
Les techniques et outils enseignes sont ceux qu'emploient bon nombre de compagnies nord americaines de renom.

*Places limitees, 15 participants maximum.*



Public cible
Cette formation s'adresse a tout professionnel qui doit << obtenir quelque chose de quelqu'un (vendre et negocier) >>  et ne se sent pas toujours outille ou efficace pour y parvenir.

Formateurs
Manuel Huger
Effisens Conseil Inc a ete creee par Manuel Huger apres 15 ans passes au sein du groupe Danone en Europe comme en Amerique du Nord. Manuel a occupe des postes en Ventes, Trade Marketing, HR et Finances. Lorsqu'il a demissionne de Danone, il occupait le poste de VP Ventes Amerique du Nord dans la division boissons. Manuel est bilingue. Il a forme plus de 4200 personnes en 8 ans. Il est aussi certifie << Master Coach>> iLead.
Christophe Mayen
Christophe Mayen est president-fondateur de MC2 Formation Conseils, une firme de consultation qui offre des services de formation, conseil en gestion, management et coaching de cadre. Il cumule pres de 20 ans d'experience en agence de communication. Il a passe l'essentiel de sa carriere chez Bos (devenue DentsuBos en 2012) ou il a occupe differents postes de haute-direction au sein des departements medias et service-conseil de l'agence. En tant qu'associe co-responsable du developpement des affaires, il a notamment mene de nombreux pitchs et presentations d'agence. Il a ainsi passe toute sa carriere a vendre des idees de communication, persuader et negocier des ententes commerciales, aussi bien aupres de nombreux partenaires medias que de clients-annonceurs de toutes tailles. 


Politique de remboursement
7 jours ou moins avant la formation : aucun remboursement
Entre 9 et 8 jours avant la formation : remboursement de 50% des frais d'inscription
10 jours ou plus avant la date de la formation : remboursement en totalite
Isarta se reserve le droit d'annuler une session de formation advenant un nombre insuffisant d'inscriptions. Dans un tel cas, la totalite des frais d'inscription seront rembourses.
Substitution
Les substitutions de participants sont acceptees sans frais jusqu'a la tenue du cours.
name: Techniques de vente : l'approche client

description:
DUBWISE SUNDAYS | Montreal Dub Club

description:
JOURNAL WRITING WORKSHOP
People world-over have been journal-writing for hundreds of years and experiencing the incredible emotional, spiritual, physical and mental benefits associated with journaling; it is an important tool to complement all of the healing work you are doing.  In this 6 week workshop, you will learn the basics of journaling, read excerpts of published journals, use many different journaling techniques to heal your situations and emotions, and leave each workshop feeling lighter and reinvigorated.
You can journal on your laptop, paper or a journal and a workbook is provided for each participant.   
 
Dates & Time:  Tuesdays 12:00pm-2:00pm from Feburary 14th- March 21st 2017 (Six Sessions) 
 
Cost: $250

About the Facilitator:
McGill Alumni Manon Wascher is a college professor, certified life coach, workshop leader, published writer and poet.  Through her company LifeCoached, Manon offers private, group and online workshops and coaches clients to reach goals, overcome hurdles and enjoy life.  Manon's recent journal-writing workshops have been held at McGill University, the BACA eating disorder clinic, Hope and Cope cancer centre and online. Manon teaches at Lasalle College Montreal. She also leads personal development seminars at Concordia University. Her articles and columns have appeared in The Daily Observer and Sun Peak Independent News, her poems have appeared in Waking Dawn and The Warbler's Song, both anthologies of Canadian poetry.
name: JOURNAL WRITING WORKSHOP

description:
We are glad to invite you to our upcoming 2 days ITIL Prep Bootcamp with 100% Money Back Guarantee.
Key Features:
*         2 Days of In-Person Bootcamp
*         2 Simulation Tests
*         ITIL Foundation Exam Voucher
*         16 PDU Certificate
*         Dedicated Learning Consultant
*         100% Money Back Guarantee
     
About ITIL Foundation
The Foundation level is the entry level certification and offers you a general awareness of the key elements, concepts, and terminology used in the ITIL(r) service lifecycle, including the links between lifecycle stages, the processes used and their contribution to service management practices.
MSys ITIL(r) Foundation Exam Prep is designed and developed by the global panel of ITIL(r) Expert instructors to ensure that our participants pass the ITIL(r) Foundation exam on their first attempt.
Our hands-on training helped many participants in transforming their careers. Our Lead Instructor focus on the key concepts, terminologies and elements included with ITIL(r) service lifecycle management. MSys Training includes best practices from ITSM processes and Service Management, ITIL(r) lifecycle Phase Interactions & Outcomes.
What you will Learn:
Service Strategy : Strategy Management for IT Services, Service Portfolio Management, Business         Relationship Management, Financial Management For IT Services, Demand Management
Service Design:  Design Coordination, Service Catalog Management, Service Level Management, Availability Management, Capacity Management, IT Service Continuity Management, Information Security Management. by Not set" REL="noopener noreferrer nofollow"> by Not set" REL="noopener noreferrer nofollow"> by Not set" REL="noopener noreferrer nofollow"> by Not set"> by Not set"> by Not set">Management
Service Transition: Transition Planning & Support, Change Management, Service Asset & Configuration Management, Release & Deployment Management, Service Validation & Testing, Change Evaluation, Knowledge Management
Service Operation:  Event Management, Incident Management, Request Fulfillment, Problem Management, Access Management, and the functions of: IT Operations, Technical Management, Application Management, Service Desk
Continual Service Improvement: Seven-Step Improvement Process
Course Agenda:
Overview of ITIL
By the end of this lesson, you will be able to explain the practice of Service Management, describe Service Lifecycle, identify key principles and models of ITIL(r) Foundation, define generic concepts in ITIL(r) 2011, discuss the processes, roles and functions in ITIL(r) Foundation.
Lesson 1: Introduction to service management
This lesson will explain the best practices in IT Service Management, identify the stakeholders in service management, describe service management roles and responsibilities and explain the types of service providers.
Lesson 2 - Service Strategy
This lesson will explain the purpose, objective, scope and value of service strategy, identify the four processes in service strategy and explain the different types of services provided.
Lesson 3 -Service Design
By the end of this lesson, you will be able to explain the purpose, objective, scope and value of service design and list the roles and responsibilities of service design.
Lesson 4 -Service Transition
Here, you will learn how to describe the purpose, objective, scope and value of service transition and explain Configuration Item (CI) and Configuration Management System (CMS).
Lesson 5 -Service Operations
By the end of this lesson you will be able to describe the purpose, objective and scope of service operations phase, list the principles of communication and explain events, alerts and incidents.
Lesson 6 -Continual Service Improvement
This lesson describes the purpose, objective and scope of CSI and explains the value of CSI to improve business.
Lesson 7 -Assessment
Test if you are ready to take the exam, solve the questions which you might get in your certification exam.

For individual or corporate training inquiries please contact Alex.Matthew@MSystraining.com or call us at 408-878-3078.
name: ITIL Foundation- 2 days Classroom Training in Montreal, QC

Cet atelier a la fois theorique et pratique vous enseignera comment composer efficacement vos images afin d'orienter le regard du spectateur et de produire l'effet esthetique escompte.


Cadrage, echelle de plans, mouvements de camera, vous ferez un tour d'horizon complet du vocabulaire cinematographique et apprendrez ainsi a traduire vos intentions en images avec plus de dexterite. 
Pour s'adapter davantage a vos besoins, l'atelier s'organise en deux parties, niveaux intermediaire le samedi et plus avance le dimanche. Vous pouvez suivre les 2 jours, ou celui de votre choix.

A ne pas manquer !





This theoretical and practical workshop will explore how to use composition to guide the viewer's eye and achieve the desired visual effect. Participants will discover a broad range of cinematic terms, including framing, covering a scene and camera movement, in order to develop a better understanding of how to translate their intentions to the screen with greater agility.


To fill your needs, the workshop is organised into 2 levels, intermediate level on Saturday and more advanced level on Sunday. You can participate to one of them or both.

description:
FOR REGISTRATION DETAILS AND GROUP DISCOUNTS INFO PLEASE CALL: TELEPHONE: 514-868-2116
About the course
This ITIL Intermediate course introduces participants the overall concepts, processes, policies, and methods associated with the Service Transition (ST) phase of the Service Lifecycle. The course covers the management and control of the activities and techniques within the ST phase. This course is designed using an engaging, exercise-based approach to learning the core disciplines of the ITIL best practice and positions the student to successfully complete the associated exam.
Audience
The main target group for this ITIL(r) Intermediate Qualification Certificate includes, but is not restricted to:

Chief information officers (CIOs)
Chief technology officers (CTOs)
Managers
Supervisory staff
Team leaders
Service designers
IT architects
IT planners
IT consultants
IT audit managers
IT security managers
ITSM trainers involved in the on-going management, co-ordination and integration of strategizing activities within the service lifecycle
Individuals who require a deeper understanding of the ITIL(r) service strategy stage of the ITIL(r) service lifecycle and how activities in it may be implemented to enhance the quality of IT service management within an organization
IT professionals working in roles associated with strategic planning, execution and control within a service-based business model, seeking an understanding of the concepts, processes, functions and activities involved in service strategy
Individuals who have attained the ITIL(r) Foundation Certificate in IT Service Management and wish to advance to higher level ITIL(r) certifications
Individuals seeking the ITIL(r) Expert Certification in IT Service Management for which this qualification can be one of the prerequisite modules
Individuals seeking progress toward the ITIL(r) Master Certificate in IT Service Management for which the ITIL(r) Expert is a prerequisite.

Prerequisite
Candidates wishing to be trained and examined for this qualification must already hold the ITIL(r) Foundation Certificate.
There is no minimum requirement but a basic IT literacy and around 2 years IT experience are highly desirable
Course Delivery

In English
In class at the IT Chapter office located in Old Montreal

Certification Exam

This three (3) days classroom-training course with examination held on the afternoon of the 3rd day and includes a sample examination and preparation to re-enforce the knowledge gained.
The format of the examination consists of a closed book paper of 8 multiple-choice complex questions, to be answered within 90 minutes. (Candidates sitting the examination in English and who do not have English as their first language will be allowed an additional 30 minutes and allowed use of a dictionary). The passing mark is 70% or more than 28 correct answers.

Course Content
Through a series of lectures designed at achieving a clear understanding of the ITIL(r) Best Practice lifecycle approach and through various exercises, assignments and discussions, participants will gain the necessary knowledge enabling them to capture:

Introduction to service transition
Service transition principles
Service transition processes
Managing people through service transitions
Organizing for service transition
Technology considerations
Implementing and improving service transition
Challenges, critical success factors and risks.

THE PROGRAM COVERS THE FOLLOWING MODULES:
Course participants have the ability to capture, understand and describe, identify, demonstrate, apply distinguish, produce, decide or analyze the following topics:
Introduction

The purpose and objectives of service transition
The scope of service transition and the processes within service transition
Value to business
The context of service transition in the ITIL service lifecycle

Service Transition Principles

The key policies and best practice principles that aid effective service transition
Optimizing service transition performance and typical metrics that can be used
Service Transition inputs and outputs by lifecycle stage

Service Transition Processes

Transition Planning and Support
Change Management
Service Asset and Configuration Management
Release and Deployment Management
Service Validation and Testing
Change Evaluation
Knowledge Management

The following topics are discussed for each of the here mentioned processes

Purpose and objectives
Scope
Value to Business
Policies, principle and basic concepts
Process activities, methods and techniques
Triggers, inputs, outputs and interfaces
Critical success factors and key performance indicators
Challenges and risks

Managing people through service transitions

Managing communications and commitment
Managing organizational and stakeholder change
Stakeholder Management

Organizing for Service Transition

Organizational development
Role of technical and application management function in service transition
Organizational context for transitioning a service
Service transition roles and responsibilities
The relationship of service transition to other lifecycle phases

Consideration of Technology

Technology requirements for service transition that support service transition as a whole and that support service transition's integration into the whole lifecycle, including knowledge management tools, collaboration and configuration management system

Implementation and improvement of Service Transition

Key activities in the introduction of service transition
An integrated approach to service transition processes
Implementing service transition in a virtual or cloud environment

Challenges, Critical success factors and risks

Challenges facing service transition
Measurement through analyzing critical success factors Core Guidance References
Potential implementation risks that could affect services currently in transition and being planned
External factors that affect the approach to service transition

ITIL(r) is a registered trade mark of AXELOS Limited.
The Swirl logo(tm) is a trade mark of AXELOS Limited.
name: ITIL(r) Service Transition - INTERMEDIATE LEVEL (3 days course)

description:
FOR REGISTRATION DETAILS AND GROUP DISCOUNTS INFO PLEASE CALL: TELEPHONE: 514-868-2116
About the course
This ITIL Intermediate course introduces participants the overall concepts, processes, policies, and methods associated with the Continual Service Improvement (CSI) phase of the Service Lifecycle. The course covers the management and control of the activities and techniques within the CSI phase. This course is designed using an engaging, exercise-based approach to learning the core disciplines of the ITIL best practice and positions the student to successfully complete the associated exam.
Audience
The main target group for this ITIL(r) Intermediate Qualification Certificate includes, but is not restricted to:

Chief information officers (CIOs)
Chief technology officers (CTOs)
Managers
Supervisory staff
Team leaders
Service designers
IT architects
IT planners
IT consultants
IT audit managers
IT security managers
ITSM trainers involved in the on-going management, co-ordination and integration of strategizing activities within the service lifecycle
Individuals who require a deeper understanding of the ITIL(r) service strategy stage of the ITIL(r) service lifecycle and how activities in it may be implemented to enhance the quality of IT service management within an organization
IT professionals working in roles associated with strategic planning, execution and control within a service-based business model, seeking an understanding of the concepts, processes, functions and activities involved in service strategy
Individuals who have attained the ITIL(r) Foundation Certificate in IT Service Management and wish to advance to higher level ITIL(r) certifications
Individuals seeking the ITIL(r) Expert Certification in IT Service Management for which this qualification can be one of the prerequisite modules
Individuals seeking progress toward the ITIL(r) Master Certificate in IT Service Management for which the ITIL(r) Expert is a prerequisite.


Prerequisite
Candidates wishing to be trained and examined for this qualification must already hold the ITIL(r) Foundation Certificate.
There is no minimum requirement but a basic IT literacy and around 2 years IT experience are highly desirable
Course Delivery

In English
In class at the IT Chapter office located in Old Montreal

Certification Exam

This three (3) days classroom-training course with examination held on the afternoon of the 3rd day and includes a sample examination and preparation to re-enforce the knowledge gained.
The format of the examination consists of a closed book paper of 8 multiple-choice complex questions, to be answered within 90 minutes. (Candidates sitting the examination in English and who do not have English as their first language will be allowed an additional 30 minutes and allowed use of a dictionary). The passing mark is 70% or more than 28 correct answers.

Course Content
Through a series of lectures designed at achieving a clear understanding of the ITIL(r) Best Practice lifecycle approach and through various exercises, assignments and discussions, participants can expect to gain competencies in the following upon successful completion of the education and examination components related to this certification:

Introduction to Continual Service Improvement
Continual Service Improvement Principles
Continual Service Improvement Process
Continual Service Improvement Methods and Techniques
Organization for Continual Service Improvement
Technology for Continual Service Improvement
Implementation Considerations
Challenges, Critical success factors and risks

The program covers the following modules:
Candidates capture concepts and terminology in the field of Continual Service Improvement. Specifically, after completion of the following sections candidates will be understand, describe, identify, demonstrate, apply, distinguish, produce, decide or analyse the topics below.
Introduction

The purpose and objectives of CSI
The scope of CSI
The value to business of adopting and implementing CSI
The approach to CSI
The business questions to be asked to ensure that a CSI initiative is warranted
The context of CSI in the ITIL service lifecycle
The inputs and outputs to CSI

Continual Service Improvement Principles

how the success of CSI depends upon an understanding of change upon an organization
how CSI drives the adoption of, and is influenced by, Service Level Management
how the Deming Cycle is critical to both the implementation and application of CSI
how CSI can make effective use of the various aspects of Service Measurement
how Knowledge Management is a mainstay of any improvement initiative
how CSI can make effective use of internal and external Benchmarks
how CSI can be used to ensure good governance where goals are aligned and good management is achieved
how frameworks, models, standards and quality systems fully support the concepts embodied in CSI

Continual Service Improvement Process

Purpose and objectives
Scope of CSI
Value to business
Policies, principles and basic concepts
The 7-step improvement process
Process activities, methods and techniques
Triggers, inputs, outputs and interfaces
How other processes play key roles in the seven-step improvement process
Critical success factors and key performance indicators
Challenges and risks

Continual Service Improvement Methods and Techniques

What to assess and when to use Assessments
Benchmarking. Specifically, the candidate will be able to describe and apply the approach to, and implementation of, benchmarking
Service measurement. Specifically designing and analyzing service measurement frameworks
Metrics. Specifically, the candidate will be able to describe the importance of properly defining metrics and measurements, demonstrate setting targets, and describe, use and interpret metrics, scorecards and reports, including balanced scorecard and SWOT analysis
Return on investment. Specifically, the candidate will be able to demonstrate how to create a return on investment, establish a business case and measure the benefits achieved
Service reporting. Specifically, articulating reporting policies and rules
How availability management techniques such as component failure impact analysis, fault tree analysis, service failure analysis, technical observation and the expanded incident lifecycle can be used by CSI
How capacity management techniques such as business, service and component capacity management, workload and demand management, and the iterative activities of capacity management can be used by CSI
How CSI needs to take IT service continuity management requirements into consideration and how CSI can use risk management to identify areas for improvement
How problem management supports the activities of CSI
How knowledge management supports CSI

Organization for Continual Service Improvement

Service owner
Process owner
Process manager
Process practitioner
CSI manager
The nature of the activities and the skills required for the seven-step improvement process
Comparing the CSI manager role with other relevant roles
How the responsibility model (RACI) can be used when defining roles and responsibilities in CSI

How the following tools can be used to assist some or all of the activities of CSI:

IT service management suites
Systems and network management
Event management
Automated incident-problem resolution
Performance management
Statistical analysis tools
Project and portfolio management
Financial management for IT services
Business intelligence/reporting

Implementing Continual Service Improvement

Critical considerations and where to start
The role of governance to CSI
The effect of organizational change for CSI
A communication strategy and plan

Critical success factors and risks

the challenges facing Continual Service Improvement
the appropriate critical success factors for Continual Service Improvement
the potential impact if the risks associated with implementing CSI

ITIL(r) is a registered trade mark of AXELOS Limited.
The Swirl logo(tm) is a trade mark of AXELOS Limited.
name: ITIL(r) Continual Service Improvement - INTERMEDIATE LEVEL (3 days course)

description:
FOR REGISTRATION DETAILS AND GROUP DISCOUNTS INFO PLEASE CALL: TELEPHONE: 514-868-2116
 About the course
The Managing Across the Lifecycle (MALC) certificate is the final module of the Service Lifecycle and-or Service Capability Intermediate courses that leads to the ITIL Expert level in IT Service Management. This course focuses on business, management, and supervisory objectives, purpose, processes, functions, activities, and on the interfaces and interactions between the processes covered in the Service Lifecycle. This course is designed using an engaging, exercise-based approach to learning the core disciplines of the ITIL best practice and positions the participant to successfully complete the associated exam.
Audience
The main target group for this ITIL(r) Intermediate Qualification Certificate includes, but is not restricted to:

Chief information officers
Senior IT managers
IT managers
Supervisors
IT professionals
IT operations practitioners
IT development practitioners
Individuals who require a business and management level understanding of the ITIL(r) service lifecycle and how it may be implemented to enhance the quality of IT service provision within an organization
Individuals seeking the ITIL(r) Expert in IT Service Management certificate, for which this qualification is the final mandatory module
Individuals seeking progress towards the ITIL(r) Master in IT Service Management, for which the ITIL(r) Expert in IT Service Management certificate is a prerequisite.

Course duration is 5 days
Prerequisite

Candidates wishing to be trained and examined for this qualification must already have two (2) credits from the ITIL(r) Foundation certificate and must, as a minimum, have obtained a further 15 credits from ITIL(r) Intermediate qualifications, and therefore a total of at least 17 credits. Candidates for the MALC qualification must present documentary evidence of this.
In addition to the prerequisite entry criteria, in order to be eligible for the MALC examination candidates must have fulfilled the following requirements:
At least 30 contact hours with an Accredited Training Organization (ATO) or an accredited e-learning solution, as part of a formal, approved training course
Before attending training for the certification it is also strongly recommended that candidates read the ITIL(r) Service Lifecycle core publications.

Course Delivery

In English
In class at the IT Chapter office located in Old Montreal

Certification Exam

This five (5) days classroom-training course with examination held on the afternoon of the 5th day and includes a sample examination and preparation to re-enforce the knowledge gained.
The format of the examination consists of a closed book paper of 8 multiple-choice complex questions, to be answered within 90 minutes. (Candidates sitting the examination in English and who do not have English as their first language will be allowed an additional 30 minutes and allowed use of a dictionary). The passing mark is 70% or more than 28 correct answers.

Course Content
Through a series of lectures designed at achieving a clear understanding of the ITIL(r) Best Practice lifecycle approach and through various exercises, assignments and discussions, participants can expect to gain the competence in the following areas upon successful completion of the education and examination components related to this certification:

Key concepts of the service lifecycle
Communication and stakeholder management
Integrating service management processes across the service lifecycle
Managing services across the service lifecycle
Governance and organization
Measurement
Implementing and improving service management capability.

The program covers the following modules:
The candidates are able to understand, describe, identify, demonstrate, apply, distinguish, produce, decide or analyze:
Key concepts of the service lifecycle

Managing services and service management
The service lifecycle:
The five stages of the service lifecycle and how they interact with each other
Considering services from end-to-end: justification, design, measuring, testing, deploying, operating and looking for ways to improve
Service value across the different stages of the service lifecycle:
How service strategy elements dictate what constitutes value, and how value is defined and measured
Realizing business value in service operation
Testing and demonstrating the service value in service transition
Monitoring service measurements and using them to support all stages of the service lifecycle
Other key concepts:
Core, enabling and enhancing services
Organizing for service management
Use of the RACI model to define and clarify roles and responsibilities, particularly in interfaces between processes and between service lifecycle stages
Risk assessment and risk management
Sharing knowledge across the service lifecycle, and the use of knowledge management

Communication and Stakeholder Management

Co-ordination of business relationship management across the service lifecycle and the role of business relationship management in communication
Stakeholder management and communication
The value of good communication and ensuring its flow across the service lifecycle:
The use of service models to aid communication on service strategy and value creation
Communication during service design
Communication during service transition
Communication during service operation
Communication during continual service improvement

Integrating Service Management Processes Across the Service Lifecycle

The integration of service management through the service lifecycle
The impact of service strategy on other service lifecycle stages
The value of a service lifecycle perspective when designing service solutions
The inputs and outputs of processes and stages in the service lifecycle
The value to business and the interfaces of all processes in the ITIL(r) Service Strategy core publication:

Strategy management for IT services
Service portfolio management
Financial management for IT services
Demand management
Business relationship management


The value to business and the interfaces of all processes in the ITIL(r) Service Design core publication:

Design co-ordination
Service catalogue management
Service level management
Availability management
Capacity management
IT service continuity management
Information security management
Supplier management


The value to business and the interfaces of all processes in the ITIL(r) Service Transition core publication:

Transition planning and support
Change management
Service asset and configuration management
Release and deployment management
Service validation and testing
Change evaluation
Knowledge management


The value to business and the interfaces of all processes in the ITIL(r) Service Operation core publication:

Event management
Incident management
Request fulfillment
Problem management
Access management


The value to business and the interfaces of the seven-step improvement process, along with the role other processes play

Managing Services Across the Service Lifecycle

Identification and assessment of customer and stakeholder needs and requirements across all service lifecycle stages, and ensuring appropriate priority is given to them
How the service design package (SDP) provides a link between service design, service transition and service operation
Managing cross-lifecycle processes to ensure appropriate impact and involvement at all required service lifecycle stages:

Flow of knowledge/experience/skills between lifecycle stages
Involve service transition in early stages of the service lifecycle
Involve operations staff, business users and other relevant stakeholders in service rehearsals


Implementing and improving services, using key sources of information for identifying the need for improvement:

Service level management (SLM) review meeting - reviewing management information and trends to ensure that services are meeting agreed service levels
Customer satisfaction surveys
Reviewing business trends and changed priorities, and keeping ahead of business projections


The challenges, critical success factors and risks of the service lifecycle stages, and potential conflicts and competing issues across the service lifecycle

Governance, Roles, People, Competence and the Organization
Starting with the need for governance, it covers the people skills and competencies, the types of service providers and organizational structures.
To meet the learning outcomes and examination level of difficulty, the candidate will be able to evaluate, check, co-ordinate, detect, monitor, test, judge, analyze, differentiate, organize, and attribute:

Governance:

The importance and impact of good governance on service management
The use of governance in sourcing
The role of the IT strategy or steering group in setting direction, policy and strategy for IT services
The application of governance in change management, through change authorization to ensure the integrity of live services. The role of the change advisory board (CAB)
The support from management systems to ensure appropriate governance


Organizational structure, skills and competence:

The challenge and application of organizational development
Assessing and applying various organizational structures for service management, and combining several perspectives in matrix organizations
Skills and competence


Service provider types and service strategies:

The different service provider types, and the implication of choosing a specific type
The selection of appropriate service



Measurement

Measuring and demonstrating business value
Determining and using metrics:

Service measurement
Service, process and technical metrics
CSFs and KPIs
Using measurements and metrics to validate, justify, direct, intervene


Design and development of measurement frameworks and methods:

Design and development of a service measurement framework
Designing measurement methods and metrics
Monitoring and control systems
Monitoring, reporting and control
Monitor control loops


Use of event management tools to increase visibility of the infrastructure and IT service delivery

Implementing and Improving Service Management Capability

Implementing service management

Understanding the high-level goals and objectives of the organization. Identifying the external (legislation, competitors etc.) and internal (organizational structure, culture etc.) drivers
Service strategy implementation taking a service lifecycle approach


Assessing service management

Assessing the current situation regarding service provision:

Strategic assessment
SWOT analysis
Gap analysis and IT service management maturity assessment
ISO/IEC 20000 certification
Six Sigma
COBIT
CMMI


Assessing current and defining future required maturity levels, quality and cost of provision
Using benchmarking to identify need for improvement for each service lifecycle stage


Improving service management

Planning for improvement with short-, medium- and longer term improvement initiatives
Using the CSI approach and Deming Cycle to ensure that the organization continues to move forward with continual improvement
The seven-step improvement process, to measure progress and enable potential improvements to the service lifecycle to be identified


Key considerations for implementation and improvement of both the practice of service management and the services themselves:

Having the appropriate business case which shows the return on investment or the return on value
Stakeholder change management


Key considerations when planning and implementing service management technologies

ITIL(r) is a registered trade mark of AXELOS Limited.
The Swirl logo(tm) is a trade mark of AXELOS Limited.
name: ITIL(r) Managing Across the Lifecycle - EXPERT LEVEL (5 days course)

description:
Important note: registrations for this course are also available through the Agile Pain Relief website. In rare cases, the number of available seats has not yet synchronized with the total number of seats offered here. In those instances, the maximum available number shown on the official website will be deemed to be accurate.
 

"The best two days of training I ever had." - Sridhar 
"A perfect insight into the Agile world." - Smita
"An absolutely fantastic course which was engaging, insightful and educational all at the same time." - Ryan
Overview
In this two day course you will use Scrum to build a new application, learning how it feels to be part of a Scrum team and how Scrum works. The course is a mix of exercises, lecture and open discussion. Along with the exercises, the course itself is run using a Scrum-like process with a product backlog, estimates, and even acceptance criteria giving students a chance to see how we handle changing requirements in Scrum.

"Fantastic. Very personable and great delivery." - Jennifer
"Wonderful course. Delivering both 'How to do it' and 'Why it works' in a fun and enlightened way." - Hugo

Key Concepts 
After completing this course you will:

have an excellent understanding of the Scrum Basics (principles, roles and meetings)
know how to go from Release Planning to Project Completion using Scrum
know the value of User Stories and Relative Estimation
understand how to build a high performance team
know how to reduce time to market and increase quality
know how to create a culture of learning and continuous improvement
fulfill the requirements of the Certified ScrumMaster Program including preparation for the CSM Exam

Finally, this is one of the few CSM courses where the neuroscience and psychology of teams is discussed as applied to managing Scrum and building effective teams.
This course qualifies for 14 PMI PDU's for PMP renewal. Pre-paid exam fee and ScrumAlliance membership are included in the course cost.
Course attendees receive electronic copies of all seminar materials (including free updates to course materials as they become available). Attendees also receive access to the "BackStage Scrum" private forum where questions and scenarios can be discussed with some of the top Scrum experts in the world.

 

"I really enjoyed the course and I know that I can start using this new knowledge immediately in my work." - Francois
"Mark is an obvious expert in his field." - James


The Agile Pain Relief Advantage
Small Class-size in Your City
Agile Pain Relief limits classes to a maximum of 20 students to ensure a quality learning environment with more opportunities to address your questions and concerns. Local training classes mean you meet and network with other professionals near you. On-site, private training also available.
In-person and Interactive
Direct learning tailored to each class and student. No canned PowerPoint presentations or webinars. Live instruction from Certified Scrum Trainers (CST) and group exercises modelled on Agile methods.
Hands-on Applications of Scrum Methods with Agile Theory
Practical examples and exercises use Scrum and Agile principles teach you how to adapt and practice Agile methods in your projects.
Online Course Materials and Support
Course attendees receive electronic copies of all seminar materials (including free updates to course materials as they become available). Attendees also receive access to the "BackStage Scrum" private forum where questions and scenarios can be discussed with some of the top Scrum experts in the world.

Cancellation and Refunds: Refund of the full registration amount will be issued upon request received up to 10 business days prior to course start date. For cancellation requests received less than 10 business days prior, credit towards a future course will be given, less $100 which may be retained for short-notice expenses incurred.
Course Location: Hosting venue to be confirmed and may be subject to change.Terms & Conditions
name: Certified ScrumMaster (CSM) Montreal February 2017

description:
Important note: registrations for this course are also available through the Agile Pain Relief website. In rare cases, the number of available seats has not yet synchronized with the total number of seats offered here. In those instances, the maximum available number shown on the official website will be deemed to be accurate.
 

Too many products fail because of poor direction and goals-- learn how to avoid being another statistic.
Weak Product Ownership is the leading cause of failure I see with Scrum Teams. The Agile Pain Relief Certified Scrum Product Owner (CSPO) course will give you the tools to improve the odds for your Team and have fun while doing it.
Overview
In an Agile organization the Product Owner holds a key role in determining which features are added to products and the order and priority of feature development.
Using Scrum and Agile planning tools, the Product Owner works with their Scrum team to lead the development process by creating and managing an efficient backlog, managing product scope, working with stakeholders, estimating budgets and release dates, and tracking team progress to deliver better quality products on time.
This 2-day Certified Scrum Product Owner training course led by Certified Scrum Trainer Mark Levison provides the tools for success with a blend of direct instruction, interactive group work, and practical exercises to gain skills, techniques, and experience in the Product Owner role.
Upon successful completion of the Certified Scrum Product Owner course, participants receive Scrum Product Owner Certification and membership to the Scrum Alliance. This course qualifies for 14 PMI PDUs for PMP renewal.
50% of Product Features are Never Used
Learn how to not be part of that statistic, and build products more efficiently
No PowerPoint (or KeyNote)
We spend two days in interactive and workshop using practical exercises and your Vision to build your Product Backlog. You will learn how your Scrum would work to build the product you see.
Limited to 20 attendees
Tired of being one of 40 people in a room? Can't see the slides? Can't hear the instructor? Agile Pain Relief keeps class sizes small for direct instruction, instructors available for your questions, and a focus on every student.
Focused on Your Needs
This course is built on Agile principles and you play the role of the Product Owner to decide what material we cover to meet your needs.

"The best two days of training I ever had." --Sridhar
"A perfect insight into the Agile world." --Smita
"Great actionable content." --Jason


 

"I really enjoyed the course and I know that I can start using this new knowledge immediately in my work." - Francois
"Mark is an obvious expert in his field." - James

 
Learning Objectives

Create a Vision that can focus and drive your team
Establish Personas that help your team focus on building a Product for the right People
Discover what is wrong with a flat Product Backlog
Build a Story Map
Understand the mechanics and execution of Scrum
Create User Stories in collaboration with the Team
Understand the importance of Ongoing Backlog Refinement
Identify the difference between a good and bad User Story (the words themselves aren't what matter most)
Use Story Splitting as one technique to deal with Large User Stories
Evaluate how your Dev Team are estimating
Examine tradeoffs between different prioritization approaches

 

The Agile Pain Relief Advantage
Small Class-size in Your City
Agile Pain Relief limits classes to a maximum of 20 students to ensure a quality learning environment with more opportunities to address your questions and concerns. Local training classes mean you meet and network with other professionals near you. On-site, private training also available.
In-person and Interactive
Direct learning tailored to each class and student. No canned PowerPoint presentations or webinars. Live instruction from Certified Scrum Trainers (CST) and group exercises modelled on Agile methods.
Hands-on Applications of Scrum Methods with Agile Theory
Practical examples and exercises use Scrum and Agile principles teach you how to adapt and practice Agile methods in your projects.
Online Course Materials and Support
Course attendees receive electronic copies of all seminar materials (including free updates to course materials as they become available). Attendees also receive access to the "BackStage Scrum" private forum where questions and scenarios can be discussed with some of the top Scrum experts in the world.

 
Cancellation and Refunds: Refund of the full registration amount will be issued upon request received up to 10 business days prior to course start date. For cancellation requests received less than 10 business days prior, credit towards a future course will be given, less $100 which may be retained for short-notice expenses incurred.
